meanings.definition: Having the quality of causing corruption or moral decay.
meanings.sent1: The corruptive influence of greed led to the downfall of the once honest company.
meanings.sent2: The corruptive behavior of the politician was exposed by the media.
meanings.sent3: The corruptive nature of the gossip spread like wildfire through the small town.
meanings.sent4: The corruptive power of jealousy can poison even the strongest relationships.
meanings.sent5: The corruptive force of lies can erode trust between friends.

meanings.sent1: The corruptive actions of the criminal gang terrorized the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The corruptive influence of negative peer pressure can lead young people astray.
meanings.sent3: The corruptive impact of the prank caused chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The corruptive force of addiction can devastate families.
meanings.sent5: The corruptive behavior of the dictator brought suffering to the entire nation.
